name: Gable End Guest House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Welcoming, friendly, fantastic breakfast to go with an excellent standard of service that we would gladly recommend to anyone looking for a base near Gatwick
reviews.title: Like staying with old friends

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Booked the accommodation last minute due to snow being forecast. And so glad this was guest house was recommended by another hotel that was already full. Nothing was too much trouble - so friendly, clean, close to Gatwick - perfect. Would have no hesitation in using again
reviews.title: Excellent!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are looking to stay overnight before a flight out of Gatwick, do book this fabulous B&B owned and run by Mary and Joseph. The main advantage is that the price for your room includes transport to and from Gatwick. So you can park your car, check into your room, have a wander around Horley, eat at Ye Old Six Bells Inn, have a good night's sleep and then be taken to Gatwick. On your return, they will collect you and off you go. We landed at Gatwick at 8 am, had a mere 5 minute wait before Joseph picked us up and as we hadn't had time for breakfast when we left, offered to cook us one before we left to come home. Absolutely brilliant customer service, all with cheery smiles and typical Irish hospitality. We will definitely return if we fly out of Gatwick again on an early flight. Thank you Mary and Joseph for making the start and end of our holiday so pleasureable (shame about the holiday, that's all!). Lynne and BD
reviews.title: Reasonably priced B&B 5 minutes from Gatwick

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here overnight before flying onwards to Jordan. The guest house (and its owners) are very charming and the whole property is pristine clean with modern fixtures and fittings that don't detract from it's quaint appeal. Every attention to detail is made, from the prompt airport transfer, to the room presentation, to the breakfast and the Irish owners' warm service. Absolutely faultless.
reviews.title: Irish charm, Irish hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room we had was in the loft - small but in no regards uncomfortable or claustrophobic. Nice and spotless bathroom too.
reviews.title: Ideal in all aspects - stay here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our recent stay at the Gable End guest house was excellent, Mary and Joe are lovely welcoming hosts. The room was clean, well kitted out with plenty of room. The breakfast was full English with everything included. Drop off and pick up at the airport was easy and we could not fault our choice of guest house. As the headline suggests, this is the best in town. Thank you Mary and Joe.
reviews.title: The best in town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: We will be back.
reviews.title: Comforting Home Away From Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ken and Maureen Hatchett. Totton, UK
reviews.title: Both side of the Hit parade

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: If you are looking to stay in the Gatwick area of London, Look no further than this Gem. I had the privilege of meeting the owners Mary and Joseph during my stay on Saturday evening. I can honestly say the incredibly outstanding warm welcome and hospitality I received during my stay was incomparable to anywhere else I had ever been.
reviews.title: Better than I expected. Brill start to my holiday!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011
reviews.text: From the sweet scent of the fresh white lilies as you enter, to the amazing attention to the little details, doillies on the tables, pictures on the walls, nik naks on the shelves, inviting rooms with a desk and chair, variety of teas and coffee, no disposable cups here, Lovely white china cup and saucer. And a coaster. Large bath towel, a hand towel large enough to wipe more than your fingertips, and a facecloth. And a decorative pull on bathroom light.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second stay at this B&B. A warm welcome from the owners who go out of their way to help, clean and comfortable rooms, a good breakfast, car parked at a reasonable rate, a free lift to the airport and back again at 7.00am when we were offered tea/coffee and toast before making our way home. What is there not to like? Maybe the room was a bit hot, but I could have opened the window! Will definitely use this place again whenever we travel from Gatwick.
reviews.title: Another excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed here for 1 night before flying out. i would highly!!! recommend this hotel to anyone, if i ever fly from gatwick in the future i will never stay anywhere else if i can help it. very! clean, friendly, warm, inviting, fantastic service!, great breakfast!, just cant rate it high enough...stay here and you wont be dissapointed!!, i guarantee it.....
reviews.title: "great start to the holiday"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Stayed overnight before my trip to the Caribbean. Joe and Mary couldn't have been more helpful and friendly, and their guest house is lovely! Room warm and cosy, car was looked after while I was away, and the breakfast was great. Actually, everything was just perfect. Will not hesitate returning, and will be recommending to my friends, family and colleagues.
reviews.title: A real home from home :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 6th March overnight & went back for a rest after overnight flight 22nd March. Good points comfortable, clean, very convenient & a most caring couple ( Mary & Joe). Included in B&B rate is a pickup from bus stop 9 in South Terminal & taking you back when required. Only a 10 min hop from Gatwick. A good tip is that they will alllow you to use a bedroom after an overnight flight if one needs a rest & a shower etc,before continuing a drive or flight home, it is really quiet,
reviews.title: Better than an Airport Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: . ( for about £40 ) This made an big difference to our Jet Lag. There is a super Pub/Restuarant only 5 mins walk across the road , it is called The 6 Bells at Horley. ( tel 01293825028 ).
reviews.title: Clean and friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011
reviews.text: This family-run B&B is perfect for those pesky overnights when forced to change from Heathrow to Gatwick: free pick-up/drop-off (and if it's too early or late, they'll call you a taxi), clean rooms, breakfast, and all the warmth of the Irish couple that runs the place. Couldn't have been happier!
reviews.title: Lovely Irish hospitality in Britain

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved my very short stay here - extremley friendly owners but not intrusive and a great fry up to boot! Thanks
reviews.title: Better than the hotels round gatwick

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011
reviews.text: We stayed with Joe and Mary for two nights to start our UK trip. The excellent reviews are all correct! The hosts are lovely, the rooms and building is charming, the breakfast is great, we couldn't recommend this place highly enough, just great thank you!
reviews.title: Lovely, warm start to our European vacation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: Gosh. Stayed here twice, and will come back again. Cozy, clean, comfortable BnB. Mary and Joseph have worked hard to earn top ratings. WiFi works, breakfast is English and generous. Beds are comfy and rooms have TVs, remotes, showers and toilets, and coffee and cookies. Lovely.
reviews.title: My second home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Gable End for over a week. Mary and Joe are the most welcoming hosts and made us feel right at home. Our room was very comfortable and the location is excellent, especially for those flying to or from Gatwick Airport. A cosy pub nearby serves lovely home-cooked food and is only a 5 minute walk away. Our week in Horley was made very special and welcoming, thanks to Mary and Joe...we couldn't recommend Gable End enough!!
reviews.title: Home away from home

description: Gatwick Gable End Guest House is a beautiful Edwardian House that was originally opened for business in March 1995. Mary, Joseph and their girls acquired the business in August 2000 and offer a warm Irish welcome to their family run guesthouse, only five minutes from Gatwick airport.We provide courtesy transfers from 7am to 9pm, outside these hours a taxi will cost approximately £5.We have free Wi-Fi access which is for use with your own laptop throughout the house.We are a completely NON SMOKING guest house. All our rooms are ensuite with tea/coffee making faclities; TV, hairdryer and iron are available on request. We serve a hearty English / vegetarian cooked breakfast from 7.30am to 9am. Outside these hours we serve a substantial continental breakfast of cereals, juices, fresh fruits, yogurts, toast and tea or coffee.We offer car parking for Gatwick airport for our guests and also non guests at reasonable rates.
